Because you’re not just boiling water anymore. You’re augmenting the contents in something like a pot, so when you boil contents that are not water, the boiling point changes. Sugar also bonds to the water molecules very well - something that isn’t always the case when combining liquid substances. If that doesn’t seem like something easy to follow then just keep it simple: you’re not boiling water anymore, you’re boiling something else. The boiling point of two unequal substances will never be exactly the same. The more dense the liquid, the harder it is to heat up and boil.
